result.execSummary:
The defendant Ruben A Baez Godoy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ruben A Baez Godoy

defendant.name: Baez Godoy, Ruben A
defendant.address: N5643 Rockridge Cir, Johnson Creek, WI 53038

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] case called at 1:52pm. 
Defendant Ruben A Baez Godoy in court, in custody, with Attorney John V Rhiel.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

ADA Shock filed the Amended Information.
The Defense admits service, waives reading.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Counts #1, #2, #3, #4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.


On Counts #1, #2, #3, & #4, the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Baez Godoy on Probation for two years, with conditions:
--not to engage in any acts or threats of violence 
--to undergo anger management counseling
--no contact with T.E.R. (dob 8/15/1999) unless approved by the Agent and agreed to by T.E.R.
--to undergo any assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge = $443 on Count #1
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge = $443 on Count #2
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge= $443 on Count #3
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge= $443 on Count #4


Days credit for time already served:  58 days
The Court requires Mr. Baez Godoy to submit to DNA sample provision at the Jefferson County Jail today. 
recess 2:08pm.

Case called at 1:25 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Ruben A Baez Godoy in court, in-custody, with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Rhiel:  Do have resolution on matter, but do not have settlement in writing. 
Court informs parties that It will proceed with bail modification today
Arguments presented; Court presents basis and denies modification of bond
Recess: 1:31 pm

NEXT: Matter to proceed as scheduled

Case called at 9:19am [mo]

Defendant Ruben A Baez Godoy in court, in custody with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
    
Mr.Baez Godoy waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
The Court reminds Mr. Baez Godoy that his bond and its conditions remain in effect
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
recess: 9:23am

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/9/15 at 11:00am    (2) Status Conference on 9/25/15 at 1:15pm

case called at 1:29-pm. [mo]
[Commissioner Fremgen presiding for Branch II Intake]
Defendant Ruben A Baez Godoy appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Svehlek indicates that Mr. Godoy is eligible for PD representation

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are not waived by the Defense

The Court requires a $500 cash bond, with conditions:
--refrain from any acts or threats of violence
--Not to leave the State of Wisconsin
recess 1:39 pm. 


NEXT: Preliminary Hearing: 8/7/15 at 8:30am
